name: 37th Annual Toronto International Dragon Boat Festival

address.streetAddress: Toronto Islands, St Lawrence-East Bayfront-The Islands, ON, Canada

description: From the humble beginning of only 27 teams participating in the first festival back in 1989, the Toronto International Dragon Boat Race Festival has evolved to a much bigger operation over the past two decades. Combining culture, sport and international flavors that incorporates a 2,500-year-old tradition with fun & excitement of an outdoor festival.

name: The Hunt for the Brightwing Butterfly - Toronto Games Week
description:
Lace up your boots! The Hunt for the Brightwing Butterfly is an immersive scavenger hunt in Toronto’s High Park. Sir Charles Lockwood, renowned Victorian naturalist, needs your help to explore the park, solve cryptic puzzles, and be the first to discover a brand new species of magical butterfly!

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Haggle on the Grange - Toronto Games Week

location.name: Grange Park, Beverley St & McCaul Street

description:
Given only a handful of cards and a snippet of the rules, players must negotiate, trade, collude with, and potentially double-cross other Toronto Games Week attendees to claim the crown of Haggle honcho! Experience a large-scale game of Sid Sackson's oft-overlooked party classic Haggle in picturesque Grange Park.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Baby Point Uncovered Walking Tour
description:
Led by archaeologists, this tour will follow the ancient path of a portion of the Carrying Place trail and trace the Indigenous presence along the Humber River in Baby Point, including settlements like the 17th-century Seneca village of Teiaiagon. This tour will address the area’s colonization and early 20th-century transformation into a garden-inspired residential community by developer Robert Home Smith.

This tour was developed and will be led by ASI. It is approximately 1.2 kilometres, on city sidewalks and some unpaved nature trails. Please note there is a steep sloped path and some stair-climbing is required during the tour.

name: Island Eats Food and Travel Festival
description:
For two sizzling days, Mel Lastman Square will transform into a vibrant island oasis, where foodies, adventurers, and culture lovers come together to taste the tropics and plan their next escape. Sample mouthwatering Caribbean dishes, sip on fruity cocktails and beer at our "Breeze and Brews" Beer Garden, and dive into an explosion of flavors that’ll transport your tastebuds straight to paradise.

What to Expect:
- Delicious eats from top island-inspired chefs & vendors
- Travel showcases & island getaway inspo from Antigua and Barbuda, St. Lucia, Barbados, Jamaica, Grenada and Trinidad and Tobago. 
- Live music, DJs & cultural performances

name: Beyond Time and Space Chinese Calligraphy Exhibition

location.name: Chinese Cultural Centre of Greater Toronto

description:
Showcasing over 80 works, encompassing both traditional and innovative styles. Among them, small-scale creations themed around wood are particularly noteworthy, promoting the diversity of calligraphic art while offering unique charm. 

During the exhibition period, calligraphy workshops will be held by experienced artists, welcoming all enthusiasts to participate with no prior knowledge required. This is a great artistic opportunity for friends and family to engage with traditional culture.

name: Welcome to Hipsville: 5 Bands, 5 DJs
description:
Get ready for the return of this iconic event, featuring The Out-Sect, Philly's premier garage-punk-soul combo! Straight from the swamps of Philadelphia, their soul-tinged psychosis is a pure shot of rhythm & booze and is sure to cure your rockin’ pneumonia and garage disease.

Local talent includes returning noisemakers: Slow Drags, rockabilly hoodlums Shook Boys, garage peddlers, Wolff & the Skylarks, and all-new power poppers the Brink!

Five bands! Five DJs spinning vinyl all night! Get your ticket to Hipsville today!

name: Game Jam Day: Board Game and PICO-8 MicroJams - Toronto Games Week

location.name: Lillian H. Smith Public Library (Lower Level)

description:
Want to make a game in a day? Join us at Micro Jam Sessions, where we'll be hosting a 1-day board game and PICO-8 game jam. This will include a hands-on workshops by Andrew Tran and Adam Saltsman (Finji), open jam time, and a showcase where everyone can play each other's projects.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: In Search of the Godmama: a Playful Workshop - Toronto Games Week

location.name: Grange Park - Beverley St & McCaul Street, Toronto, ON M5T 2W7

description:
This workshop is an alternative ritual for exchanging goddesses from your own cultures. However, the conjuration may surprise you - your goddesses might have been acquainted centuries before we met. 

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! name: DESIFEST 2025
description: Join us for the biggest celebration of South Asian music, culture, and community in Toronto. Bringing 12 hours of live music, dance, and unforgettable vibes. With electrifying performances, Bollywood beats, delicious food vendors, and family-friendly activities, this is more than a concert — it’s a full-day cultural experience. Celebrate with thousands of fans from across the city as we showcase incredible talent, community pride, and the spirit of South Asian creativity in the heart of Toronto. Don’t miss your chance to be part of something truly special.

name: Between the Public and the Private: Vector Festival Game Residency Keynote
description:
Join critically-acclaimed documentary filmmaker and activist Min Sook Lee for his keynote talk on exploring video games as authethnographic and autofictive practice. The residency is curated by Bracy Appeikumoh and presented with the support of Hand Eye Society, Toronto Games Week, and the Centre for Culture and Technology at University of Toronto.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Kitten Cup Tea Party: A Capy Castaway Catstravaganza! - Toronto Games Week

location.name: Grange Park, Beverley St & McCaul Street

description:
It’s the return of our annual Kitten Cup Tea Party in the Park! Meet local indie devs, sip some tea, check out Pekoe and our upcoming game Capy Castaway. We also have fun capybara inspired activities, exclusive giveaways, and don’t forget to participate in our tea-pose tradition!

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Vintage and Antique Party
description:
Join us for a weekend filled with unique finds and treasures! From retro clothing, to home decor, plants furniture and more, this event is a vintage lover's dream come true. Browse through a curated selection of one-of-a-kind items while jamming out to a DJ and live acoustic music. We are clearing out inventory an everything will be priced to sell! 

This event is a fundraiser for Lost Tonic Studio! Our mission statement is to provide accessible creative space for musicians and mixed media artists in Toronto. Your purchase will help us accomplish our dream of supporting local artists in this incredible city.

name: Game Jam Day: What's Next, Jammer? - Toronto Games Week

location.name: Lillian H. Smith Public Library (Lower Level), 239 College St

description:
Join Gina Hara (GAMERella), Adam Saltsman (Finji), and Michael Iantorno (Game Arts International Network) as they share their perspectives on the cultural and economic value of game jams. Kim Gibson (Ontario Creates) will highlight how jammers and new creators can apply for prototype funding. Supported by Ontario Creates and the CMF.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Alan Cross Talks - All About U2
description:
Legendary podcaster, broadcaster, and music expert Alan Cross talks all about U2 - at Toronto's U2 Day. U2 Day runs from 3:00 pm until very late, but Alan Cross takes the stage at 7:00 pm to talk all about U2 and take your questions.

Hourly door prizes, including retro record players (but with Bluetooth) complete with U2 coloured vinyl records to go with each on. And custom U2 bluetooth speakers - pre-loaded with U2's biggest hits.

name: Weston Village Yard Sale

location.name: Weston Village - Easy access by TTC or UP Express to Weston GO Station

description: Visit Toronto's Largest Street Sale! Now in its 36th year, visit over twelve blocks of new and gently used treasures. Come shop the neighbourhood.

name: Pixel Power Play - Toronto Games Week
description:
Pixel Powerplay is a gaming event to celebrate and showcase the creativity, diversity and talent of the video game industry from Canada and beyond. Connecting developers and creators together! Come check out some games before they're launched to the public.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Hanlan’s Point Pride Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us to celebrate 2SLGBTQIA+ pride and enhance the natural area at Hanlan’s Point on the Toronto Islands.  

You must purchase your own ferry ticket to the Island. Visit the City's website for the ferry schedule and to purchase a ferry ticket online at toronto.ca/ferry 

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Community Environment Day at Fenside Arena
description:
Join Councillor Burnside (Ward 16) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Village Day & Sidewalk Sale

location.name: Yonge Street Sidewalks (Lawrence to Yonge Boulevard)

description:
Join us for an annual event that provides a fun family outing and a showcase of local businesses and services. 

Activities include: a village-long sidewalk sale, live bands, street balloons, face painting, free caricatures, bouncy castle. All activities (excluding the sidewalk sale) are provided free to the public, while supplies last.

We have something for everyone, all are welcome!

Rain or shine.  Activities & performances subject to change or cancellation due to severe weather conditions.

name: Father's Day Food Tour

location.name: Kensington Market - exact meeting point provided upon booking

description: Skip the usual gifts and share an experience he’ll truly enjoy! Embark on a flavorful journey through Kensington Market, one of Toronto’s most famous neighbourhoods, and get a chance to fill dad’s heart alongside his stomach. Each stop is a chance to connect, explore, and indulge. We’ve handpicked a lineup of hearty bites and hidden gems that are sure to impress. Make this Father’s Day one to remember with a delicious adventure you’ll both enjoy.

name: Toronto Park Summit
description:
Join us and hundreds of park changemakers—NGOs, community groups, municipal staff, and advocates from across the Greater Toronto Area and beyond—for a day of knowledge sharing, connection, and inspiration. 

Join the conversation on the future of city parks in Toronto, explore potential collaborations, and gain fresh perspectives from diverse voices in the community.

name: Cultural Hotspot Launch: Jane and Finch 2025
description:
The City of Toronto is proud to launch the 2025 Cultural Hotspot program, celebrating the Jane and Finch community from June to October. This exciting initiative supports local artists and arts organizations to deliver free, public arts programming across the neighbourhood. This free launch event inside Jane Finch Mall (Northwest Entrance) brings together powerful performances, local traditions, local food, and civic pride to spotlight the rich cultural fabric of the Jane and Finch neighbourhood. Arrive early! The first 250 guests will receive a canvas shopping tote designed by a local Jane and Finch creative - available while supplies last.

Featured Highlights (subject to change): 
- Headliner performances by Juno-nominated rapper Clairmont The Second and LolaBunz
- Welcome and blessing by Anishinaabe Grandmother Kim Wheatley
- Hosted by Kibra 
- Music by DJ CUR8
- Musical performance by Wheel It Studios
- Vogue showcase by the Toronto Kiki Ballroom Alliance
image: https://secure.toronto.ca/webapps/CC/fileAPI/edc_eventcal/Wheel It Studios Photo by Terryl Knox_kH_5oud2HFu9SL12baVKTA.jpg

name: Spirit of York Presents Prohibition
description:
You didn’t hear it from us, but there’s a party brewing. 

Slip around back and step into Prohibition, a secret speakeasy soaked in sin, swing, and spirits. Set inside a building with real ties to Toronto’s bootlegging past, this is no ordinary night out. It’s the Roaring ‘20s, but with better booze. Expect handcrafted cocktails straight outta the 1920s, bites inspired by the golden age of grit and glamour, burlesque by Knox Harter, Smokin' Dolores and Aza Lia, sleight-of-hand by Chris Mayhew and swing, sass, and lots of opportunities for photos.

name: Dino Run
description:
Got a dinosaur lover? This fun-filled morning starts with costumed Dino Specialists teaching participants about dinosaurs through song, dance, storytelling, and games. Then children are welcome to  transform into Dino Explorers, tasked with chasing and recapturing runaway dinosaurs in an exciting, non-competitive run around our 220m figure-eight skate trail. As they dash and track down their dino friends, they’ll stay active, build confidence, and develop a love for movement—all in a fun, supportive environment.

The ultimate way to combine learning and movement this summer, let the prehistoric fun begin!

name: Sidewalk Sensation Event

location.name: Bayview Ave - Soudan Ave to Davisville Ave

description:
Stroll Bayview Avenue for a day of family-friendly fun, live entertainment, and amazing local shopping!

Explore the fantastic shops and discover the perfect gift for Father’s Day while enjoying great vibes all around. Enjoy free activities and giveaways, including face-painting for kids, colour-in greeting cards, delicious food samples from local restaurants. 

Bring the whole family, you won’t want to miss it!

name: Threads of Home at Gibson House - Opening Launch
description:
Experience the Threads of Home pop-up exhibit, where powerful narratives of belonging and identity are woven together through the stories and works of Jamileh Hasan.

This exhibit runs from June 14 to October 12.

name: 2SLGBTQ+ Family Pride Celebration
description:
Look forward to food, story, and circle time with Jerry, drag performances by Sandy Joint, Hillary Yaas, and Baby Bel Bel, live music by DJ Tangerine, and Bachata dance with Tatiana Alfaro! 

Resources from The Children’s Book Bank, Toronto Public Library, BabyReady, Interwoven Connections, Camp Ten Oaks, High-Park Parkdale CDI, EYET EarlyON, Sherbourne Health and more, will be available.

name: World Wide Knit in Public Day at Gibson House Museum
description:
June 14th is International World Wide Knit in Public Day.
Around the world knitters will be gathering to celebrate their craft in public spaces.  
Knitters are invited to show pride in their craft and celebrate Pride by gathering under the tent on the south lawn of the museum to knit or crochet. 
Visitors can work on their own projects or use the yarn and needles provided to add to the rainbow flag decorations.

name: Toronto Queer Sports Pride Party
description:
Get ready for the ultimate Pride celebration! 

We are excited for new members from other Toronto’s  2SLGBTQ+ sports leagues to join us for a night of unforgettable fun, fierce energy, and non-stop Pride anthems that’ll have you dancing all night long. This is more than a party - it's the Pride event of the season, and you won’t want to miss it!

name: Beaches Arts & Crafts
description: Toronto’s favourite free outdoor market is back, rain or shine!  Shop artisan treasures from over a hundred Canadian vendors. Discover a curated selection of handmade goods, from textiles and jewellery to ceramics, gourmet foods, kids’ toys and more. Treat yourself to something special or find the perfect gift.

name: Christian Music Festival

address.streetAddress: Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen St W

description:
Join us for the Christian Music Festival—a vibrant event lifting the name of Jesus high in downtown Toronto! This all-day celebration is perfect for families, friends, churches, and all who love worship and community.

Enjoy uplifting performances by talented artists and bands, and explore local vendors offering delicious food and unique merchandise.

Don’t miss this joyful opportunity to gather, worship, and celebrate the love of Jesus in a welcoming atmosphere.

Let’s make it a day of joy, worship, and unity!

name: Variety's Country Night
description:
Country-themed line dancing event, in collaboration with Cheatin’ Hearts!  Learn line dances to classic country hits and the latest chart-toppers. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned dancer, this night is all about having a blast on the dance floor! 

This western-themed shindig is perfect for ages 14 and up, so grab your friends and family for a Saturday night filled with country music, two hours of line dancing, refreshing drinks, contests, and chances to win fantastic prizes!

organizer.name: Variety – the Children’s Charity of Ontario & Variety Village
